block.p: Fatigue a Labor Issue Labor unions and legislators are concerned about exhaustion on the job as workers log a growing number of overtime hours. PAGE 32
Israel's Delicate Balance Prime Minister Ehud Barak's effort to complete a constitution, which Israel has avoided for 52 years, has stunned those who have been slowly laying the groundwork. PAGE 6

Israel's Delicate Balance Prime Minister Ehud Barak's effort to complete a constitution, which Israel has avoided for 52 years, has stunned those who have been slowly laying the groundwork. PAGE 6

A View From the South In Dixie County, Fla., there is talk of hard times and high gas prices, but little talk of voting. People see the candidates as two similar men, born to the country club. PAGE 22
Priceless Art, but No Money The Barnes Foundation, the famed gallery near Philadelphia, has depleted its endowment, leaving it without money to care for its Cezannes and Matisses. PAGE 18
Europe's New Season At hot hangouts in seven cities, nighttime means the fun is just starting. TRAVEL

The Soul of 'Kane' Orson Welles's ''Citizen Kane'' is thought to be based on the life of William Randolph Hearst. But how would we understand the movie if Kane's model were actually Welles? ARTS & LEISURE

New York: The First Year What makes someone move to New York City? According to a star athlete, a gay teenage runaway, Israeli dot-commers and others who have moved here, it is the chance to transform a life. MAGAZINE
